messages: ede74f5c4a151a239e1c7df860326a26 (19:59): drop (select table_name from user_tables)
ede74f5c4a151a239e1c7df860326a26 (19:59): how do I do that?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:00): spool drop_tables.sql
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:00): select 'drop table '|| table_name ||' cascade;' from user_tables;
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:01): @drop_tables
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (20:03): may want to do "set pages 0 feedback off" first
231d6a7a6c981512175ff5044b477196 (20:05): when converting a numeric to varchar, is there a reason i should choose to_char over cast?
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (20:09): adiamas: if you want it formatted, then yes
231d6a7a6c981512175ff5044b477196 (20:10): ahh.. but if i don't care about formatting then cast is fine?
ede74f5c4a151a239e1c7df860326a26 (20:15): hali: that's a hack coolz

6c1b239c0e2a843cfbb9726b2b528ca5 (20:24): hello, how can I convert a long type to char? I want to do something like "select table_name || ',' || search_condition from user_constraints" but it's not possible as search_condition is a long type, I have tried TO_CHAR but doesn't work
ede74f5c4a151a239e1c7df860326a26 (20:36): hingwah: it works
6c1b239c0e2a843cfbb9726b2b528ca5 (20:37): quag|work, you can try "select to_char(search_condition) from user_constraints"
6c1b239c0e2a843cfbb9726b2b528ca5 (20:37): quag|work, anyway I got an answer from google already,thx
ede74f5c4a151a239e1c7df860326a26 (20:37): select to_char(232,'999') from dual
6c1b239c0e2a843cfbb9726b2b528ca5 (20:38): quag|work, long mean long raw, not long integer
ede74f5c4a151a239e1c7df860326a26 (20:38): ok i lose
6c1b239c0e2a843cfbb9726b2b528ca5 (20:39): quag|work, http://asktom.oracle.com/pls/ask/f?p=4950:8:::::F4950_P8_DISPLAYID:839298816582#10650725404823
75273e2d05e97198fa881ed7690ca760 (20:44): may I use another schema's function?
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (20:45): cguo: if you have access to it, yes
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (20:45): schema.function_name(foo);
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (20:46): that works for most database objects
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (20:46): assuming the proper GRANTs have been done
75273e2d05e97198fa881ed7690ca760 (20:46): mm, let me try, it seems have grant
75273e2d05e97198fa881ed7690ca760 (20:54): is it right I need DBA to "grant execute function_name" in order to use it?
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (20:55): cguo: either a DBA or the schema owner
607c4806ca15b47dcc0effd779440d55 (20:55): grant execute on schema.function_name to user;
